title: FYI: Critbased adc's are still the best lategame scaling champs and therefore shouldn't be buffed
body:
The adc patch was very succesful in my opinion. The fact they aren't performing well at the moment has a lot of causes that isn't directly tied to their kit, base damage or items.

- They are the natural predator of tanks and tanks have been overnerfed and hardly see play now or just build full damage. 
- Their natural predators the assasins have received several buffs for several patches now
- Supports got nerfed
- Turrets got nerfed and Baron is weak. Adc's are no longer needed to take objectives. 
- Snowball is out of control: The game is already decided before the crit based adc got time to collect his items and scale into lategame

So yes, in an environment where the champs they counter don't get played and the meta is focused on early game and objective control it is obvious crit based champs won't do well. Buffing them would be terrible because it would mean to go back to square one. They would either scale faster or become better in early game and become stronger than assasins etc. 

I would rather see indirect buffs that aslo improve the overall gameplay like reduce snowballing, buff towers and buff tanks so crit based adc's have a place in the game again rather than straightup buffing them and going back to square one regarding adc's.

edit: Instead of buffing tanks the amount of true damage in the game should be adressed and rageblade

actually, the main issue with tanks is that riot reduced their tankiness and upped their damage. if they could revert this and make true damage not so easily accessible then tanks would be in a great spot again

What is depressing is that they've already removed  core defensive stats or gutted them into non-viability.

Tanks used to have HP + Resistances (that actually fucking mattered, armor is a serious fucking joke and is simply ***NEVER WORTH THE GOLD ON ANY CHAMPION EXCEPT FOR MALPHITE***) + HP Regen + Dodge + AS Slows + Crit Damage Reduction + AA damage reduction.

Of those stats, Tanks effectively only have HP and. . . um . . . Tabi?  Magic resist is still good, but not relevant here.  

It used to be 2+ members of the team would go FH (when it slowed AS by literally twice as much as now, and gave more armor for a lower cost) now I can't remember the last time I've seen a single person buy it.  Cold Steel, or rather, the passive it replaced before it was named, was a 20% ms and attack speed slow, not is a 10% as slow alone [which was somewhat recently buffed back to 15% at least, but it now has a shorter duration]  Randuin's active used to be a four second AoE movement and attack speed slow of equal value.  Now the AS slow is entirely fucking gone, the duration is fucking cut in half (only 2 seconds vs 4) and its even a weaker slow than it used to be (55% instead of 60%) while the item gives less stats, and costs more. 

HP regen is a joke, and tank items other than 'Mogs don't even have it any more at fucking all, except for {{item:3800}} which then has next to no defensive stats to pair with that regen, but with its active it is easily the single best tank item in the game currently, which say a fuckton about how much tank items have been utterly fucking annihilated.  Even if you have massive HP regen, its out of combat, like Ocean Dragon or Warmogs, and utterly useless in the fight which is the antithesis of how it used to be, with HP regen working for tanks to counter the lifesteal and spell vamp of damage classes.  ADCs still treat tanks as mobile fountains or HP batteries due to rune alone, let alone actual lifesteal items (which, of course, just got systemic buffs across the board +5 AD and -100g for virtually all of them) but tanks no longer have in combat regen.

Oh, and then think of all the extra instances of true damage flooding in.  Between IE and Conquerer, when I play a tank I die from between 45-75% true damage, even if the other team has no champions with innate true damage.  Died to a Yi and Vayne the other day as a Nautilus, took 89% of my max hp in true damage, dying in 3.7 seconds.  Sure they both had a rageblade, but I was doing well that game and had a full defensive build.  Too bad my 300+ armor did literally fucking nothing, and my 4k hp + shield melted to over 1k post mitigation DPS from just two people.
when riot add 70 armor leveel 1 on aftershock nobody speaks , then people speak about 20% true dmg that we had in old runes as well

Riot never reduced the tankiness of tanks.

Removing the true damage would make tanks even more tanky than they already are.
full-tank builds tend to have around 1000 less hp than before
and 100 more armor and multiplicative 20% damage reduction vs magic damage
Not too long ago riot started nerfing HP and buffing resistances. They have less Hp but more damage reduction

Which is now better ignored via...
1. dealing hybrid damage with rageblade
2. going ap adc kai'sa or similar
3. improved last whisper items reducing TOTAL armor
4. percentage hp damage such as bloodrazor
5. conqueror
6. sustain... seriously... sustain of damage dealers via lifesteal or runes or innate kit means that they basically no longer typically care about damage dealt to them unless it can 1-shot them. Like before a malphite ground slam or a cho'gath rupture landing would chunk a meaningful amount of their hp and they'd have to respect that damage. It became a race between the tank's higher hp bar but lower dps and the opponent's lower hp bar but better dps. Either side could win if they played it to their advantage and depending on point in the game. Now it's more often that the dps heavy champ doesn't give a crap about the chunk damage they might be up against from their tankier opponent. If it can't 1-shot them... they basically dps through it regardless of point in game or how well their opponent played and come out ahead. That's not healthy for the game. It's just as bad as when tank maokai could run up to an adc and 2 shot them while taking 0 damage.

To put this in another more simple to understand matter... If I double the armor on an army tank (irl) but quadruple the killing power of an rpg... it's an overall nerf to the army tank. Even if it got buffed... the buff doesn't matter and in the end it is weaker. That's kinda what we have here in league. Some stuff getting far overbuffed and it means that other stuff that could/would/should be in a good spot now ISN'T in a good spot... because something else got overbuffed to the point it just beats it even when it shouldn't. to the point that it's better in every situation or 99 out of 100 situations. That's kinda not healthy for the game.

Agreed. But their damage was upped to... waveclear better and to be able to fight back against bruisers and fighters (within reason). I'd argue some are a bit too strong in the latter category compared to how they should be in lane. And as for the former... this can easily be fixed. Take tanks' main waveclear ability(s) and cut the damage said ability(s) do to champs. Like you do 80 damage to champs with a spell but 120 damage to minions. This gives them the waveclear they need while not making it like the meta (quite awhile back now) where maokai could delete an adc while building full tank. Pretty simple fix. And it allows tanks to waveclear and minimize tower dive potential onto themselves by bruisers and fighters in lane. But also rewards fighters and bruisers who can force them to fight away from tower because the tank won't be able to trade back as much damage as they do now. Because w/o items... tanks were doing comparable dmg to that of bruisers or fighters... which had to be the case because they needed that base dmg on their spells in order to farm properly since... no bonus dmg to minions on their abilities. Thus changing that let's them farm better w/o being stupidly strong w/o items to fight against AND removing much of why we needed conqueror in the first place.

Agreed; however, they should also look to flatten (not completely, but slightly) the power curve of adc's. As in - improved early but not to where you can't play a melee top or a mage or assassin mid - and decreased late so that other roles can compete for being the carry late game too if played properly.

It shouldn't be... you get a bow; your opponent gets a handgun (early). You get a rifle, they get a rifle (mid). They get an assault rifle and a trench, you get an ac 130 gunship and a tank (late). But that's kinda more akin to how it is for an adc.

Like I said before this adc pair of patches... instead of pushing their late game outscaling more... Riot should make them more competitive throughout the early/mid game and reduce their competitive advantage late. They don't need the exact SAME power curve as other champs/roles... but it shouldn't be so far off whack that they're either unplayable due to game ending in 20 nor unkillable due to game lasting until they're full build and them having such superior damage, safety, etc. late. They can be slightly weaker early and somewhat better late w/o having to make it so damn extreme that they're either useless or the SOLO DECIDER/damage source in the game. That's what these 2 patches SHOULD have done.
